Articles.Content:
So I am currently mourning the loss of Jebidiah. He is currently in a 5 million km orbit over Kerbin in his some suit. He has quite a bit of science on him from Minmus. Do I need to kill him to be able to redo my Minmus experiments for full science?

He will be sorely missed.
Don`t kill him... as Science progresses, there is still Hope for him

just rescue him or to the mission again. you will get the same science as he has at the moment. science points only counts when you bring them back or send them back to kerbin.

don't kill him. send a rescue mission with bill and bob (or remoted)

because the missing life support in stock ksp you can rescue EVERY kerbal in a stable orbit or on a landable orbital body (except EVE - that's really hard but not impossible).

Thanks for the responses. I have done more reading today and your posts have convinced me that I will attempt to rescue him again.

I will watch some of the suggested orbital rendezvous videos when I get home.
